name: Gentoo
description: Gentoo is a source-based Linux distribution known for its extreme configurability, performance optimization, and flexibility. It uses the Portage package system and allows users to compile everything from source with custom options.

sections.title: Early Years
sections.text: Gentoo was founded by Daniel Robbins in 2000. It was inspired by the FreeBSD ports system and designed to give users maximum control over their system environment.

sections.title: Growth and Development
sections.text: Gentoo introduced Portage, a powerful package management system that uses ebuild scripts and user-defined compile flags (USE flags) to tailor software builds to individual needs.

sections.title: Current Status
sections.text: Gentoo remains popular among advanced users and developers who need granular control over performance and dependencies. It has an active community and regular updates.

sections.title: Compile-Time Optimization
sections.text: Gentoo's hallmark is that software is built from source with user-defined optimization settings. This allows fine-tuned performance tailored to specific hardware and use cases.
